response.original_title: The Human Face of the Pacific: Atoll Life in Kiribati
response.overview: The Republic of Kiribati is one of the most isolated places in the Pacific and because of this it has been possible for its people to retain much of their traditional way of life. In this film, made on Tabiteuea Island four years after independence, we witness a special three-day ritual dating from pre-colonial times, in which Manerrua – a schoolgirl of 14 – celebrates her first menstruation
response.title: The Human Face of the Pacific: Atoll Life in Kiribati
